name: Sidebar Callout
description: Narrow supplementary content block positioned alongside main body text, containing definitions, context notes, related statistics, or cross-references. Occupies 4-5 columns adjacent to the main text column, visually differentiated with g10 background or left border accent.

grid.columns: Main text: 1-11 (11 columns), Sidebar: 12-16 (5 columns) — or mirrored: sidebar 1-5, text 6-16
grid.margins: $spacing-05 (16px) gap between main text and sidebar, $spacing-05 internal padding in sidebar

components: PatternBlock(sidebar-callout) as container wrapping both text and sidebar
Main body text: $body-long-01 in $text-01, occupying 11 columns
Sidebar container: 5 columns wide, $ui-01 (g10) background with $spacing-05 padding
Sidebar heading: $heading-03 in $text-01 or $label-02 bold in $blue-60
Sidebar body: $body-short-01 in $text-02, concise supplementary content
Optional icon: Carbon icon (20px) in $blue-60 next to sidebar heading
Optional left border: 3px solid $blue-60 instead of full g10 background
Optional 'See also' link: $label-01 in $blue-60 for cross-reference
rules: Sidebar occupies exactly 4-5 of 16 columns — narrower than that is unreadable, wider competes with main text
Sidebar content must be supplementary — readers should understand the main narrative without reading sidebars
Use g10 background OR left border accent, never both — choose one differentiation method
Sidebar text uses $body-short-01 — one scale smaller than main body to reinforce visual hierarchy
Maximum 150 words per sidebar — it's a callout, not a parallel narrative. Longer content belongs in main body
Sidebar heading uses $heading-03 or $label-02 bold — clearly labels what the supplementary content covers
Sidebar vertically aligns with the paragraph it supplements — anchored to the relevant main text passage
Maximum one sidebar per page — multiple sidebars fragment the reader's attention

printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed — sidebar stays within assigned columns

accessibilityNotes: Use <aside aria-label='...'> for sidebar container — signals supplementary content to screen readers
Sidebar must linearize correctly in reading order — in the DOM, place it after the paragraph it supplements
Icons next to sidebar headings must have aria-hidden='true' if decorative, or alt text if meaningful
'See also' links must have descriptive link text — not just 'See also' but 'See also: Section 3 on Data Privacy'
antiPatterns: Never place essential information only in a sidebar — it's supplementary content that can be skipped
Never exceed 150 words — long sidebars become parallel columns competing with main text for attention
Never use more than one sidebar per page — multiple sidebars fragment the reading experience
Never float a sidebar without anchoring it to a specific paragraph — unanchored sidebars feel disconnected
Never use the same typography scale as main body text — sidebar text must be visually subordinate ($body-short-01 vs $body-long-01)
